page.title: 06Seven Dials
page.content: I dashed down the road to the Seven Dials hoping I wasn't going to miss my bus. I gazed around at the familiar place. The cars were tooting and hooting to each other, the people bustled in and out of the shops. I disappeared into a crowded sweet shop to buy a 13p packet of crisps. I just stopped myself from buying some mallows for 1p each. I emerged and turned to the road to tackle the zebra_crossing. The 'little green man' started bleeping and I walked across safely. Here the people were milling about everywhere and I dodged in and out, past the video shop, the baker' and the optician's to reach the bus_stop. The bus came, I climbed in thankfully, paid my 15p fare and it started to chug away.
